content.description: Bouldery moves on wicked small holds. Super fun!
content.location: This route is just right of Isolation

content.description:
Good movement, good bolting, good variety of styles needed, iffy rock.

It seemed weird to have to top out over the last draw, to almost horizontal rock. But that last move is a doozy, and then to find, some saintly genius put a second set of anchors up there, so you can rap into the harder climbs.

I didn't set it, but I'll start the bidding at 10c.
content.location: Keep going left, past the stump, past the obvious ledge, around the corner.

content.description: Still a crumbly mess in places, but some of the movement is quite nice. Easier than its neighbors to the right, but still powerful and thoughtful.
content.location: Farthest left on the west face, about 8 feet from the arete. (There is one more bolted route around the corner.)

climbs.name: Taken 2
climbs.fa: Kory Kowallis, Cole Bradburn, Darren Knezek

content.description: Start on the right side of the ledge and climb upwards toward some bolts.  Clip the bolts and if you make it to the top with out falling, that would be considered a redpoint, flash, or onsite. If you fall, try again. The crux comes within the first 2 bolts so bring a stick clip if you would feel more comfortable.  After the crux, climb through bigger holds to a few small holds just below the chains.
content.location: Next route to the left of Exile.

content.description: Climb up a little slab and clip the first bolt.  Pass a little bulge then up through easier terrain. After 4 bolts you will join 29.  This is the direct version to the chains.  5.7++ or 5.8-.
content.location: To the right of 29. Start down the hill a bit on a landing.

content.description: Desolate technical climbing up the left side of the wall.
content.location: This is the route that is on the left side of the wall

content.description: Slabby climb on slippery rock. Super fun moves.
content.location: Just left of Hall of Flags. It shares the same first bolt and trends left. On the right(west) side of the Isolation Wall corridor.

content.description: Technical route up very water polished rock. Start out by doing some stemming. Find the proper under cling holds to get yourself over the bulge. A crossover to a small divot will get you to the easier slabby climbing to the chains.
content.location: 4th route in from the right. In between Black Number 0 and Raspberry Dreams.

content.description: This is a powerful technical route on bullet proof rock. This is a super classic route! Solid at the grade.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the wall and shares anchors with Siberia.

content.description: Climb the slab directly opposite of the 5.12s at Isolation. The route is the one that goes straight up. There are two other lines that go to the right and left of Hall of Flags. Steeper than in looks.
content.location:
As you head into the corridor look on the right and you will see the climbs.  Three routes all start with the same first bolt.

Hall of Flags is the direct middle line.

content.description: Climb a low angled slab in the far left corner of Isolation up to big pockets on steeper terrain. Angle up and left through the seam and end on the chains of Exile.
content.location: The route starts in the upper most, left wall in the Isolation corridor.

content.description:
A burly, desperate start through three bolts followed by an even more desperate, balancy sequence to the fourth bolt.

Somewhat reasonable holds then appear, followed by a short, fun jug fest at the top.
content.location:
The third from the left bolt line on the west-facing wall (the wall on your left as you enter the alcove).

Starts above the rounded tree stump.

content.description: Same start as Wilderness but head right at the horizontal break to reach a shallow right facing corner.  Gain the top of the corner and follow improving holds to the finish.
content.location: The right most route at this cliff.

content.description: The moves are a lot harder then they look. The beginning ramp is deceiving. Fun moves all the way to the top.
content.location: Very back(south) of the Isolation Wall corridor.

content.description: Farthest right route at Isolation. This route shares the first bolt with Hall Of Flags, and Raspberry Dreams. After clipping the second bolt follow the good pockets and bad feet up and to the right. Good holds lead to a mantle right before the chains. Quality climbing and quality rock.
content.location: Farthest right route when you walk into the Isolation corridor.
